# My Memory

> Intelligent semantic search across your notes using AI

## Overview

My Memory is an open-source Electron desktop app that provides AI-powered semantic search across multiple note sources. It uses a spotlight-style UI (Cmd+Shift+Space) for quick access.

## Key Features

- Semantic search powered by Gemini AI
- AI-generated answers from your notes
- Apple Notes integration (macOS)
- Obsidian vault integration
- Local files (markdown, text, PDF)
- Notion integration
- Menu bar app
- Plugin architecture for extensibility

## Tech Stack

- Electron
- TypeScript
- SQLite (local caching)
- Gemini/OpenRouter/Ollama (LLM providers)

## Links

- Source: https://github.com/ShubhenduVaid/my-memory
- Documentation: https://github.com/ShubhenduVaid/my-memory/tree/master/docs
- Issues: https://github.com/ShubhenduVaid/my-memory/issues
- License: MIT

## Installation

```bash
npm install
echo "GEMINI_API_KEY=your_key" > .env
npm run start
```

See /docs/ARCHITECTURE.md for detailed system design.
